medical_history.chief_complaint: Generalized pruritus, nausea, vomiting, and abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced worsening generalized pruritus for 3 weeks, with poor appetite and a 30 lb weight loss. Denied significant nausea or vomiting until the night before admission when he developed nausea and vomiting after eating. Mid-abdominal and epigastric pain have been mild since then. Patient reports dark-colored loose bowel movements and mild dysuria with intermittent hematuria.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 2 diabetes, anemia, coronary artery disease (CAD), chronic kidney disease (CKD), chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), diverticulosis, gastric ulcer status post partial gastrectomy, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), and atypical urine cytology.
medical_history.family_history: Son with myocardial infarction; mother had Alzheimer's disease; father had myocardial infarction.
